channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [KAFKA-4176] Node stopped receiving heartbeat responses once another node started within the same group
item.description:
I have 3 nodes working in the same group. I started them one after the other. As I can see from the log the node once started receives heartbeat responses
for the group it is part of. However once I start another node the former one stops receiving these responses and the new one keeps receiving them. Moreover it stops consuming any messages from previously assigner partitions:

Node0

item.environment:
Centos 7: 3.10.0-229.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Fri Mar 6 11:36:42 UTC 2015 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Java: java version "1.8.0_101"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_101-b13)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.101-b13, mixed mode)
item.summary: Node stopped receiving heartbeat responses once another node started within the same group

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
We expect that when we add a new node to a group that rebalancing will take place and consumption will stop for a bit.

So the main questions are:
1. Did it ever resume consuming?
2. How long did the rebalance take - i.e. from the time a node was added until consumption resumed.

We are lacking some information to answer this. We need to know:

  • What time was the new node added
  • When did consumption resume (if ever)
  • At least from minutes of logs from all the nodes in the group from the point the new node was added.

1. No
2. The second node starts / rebalance very fast == 2 or 3 seconds.

However I found out what was the problem. The problem is that when you finish your topology with print() then it doesn't rebalance:

KStream<String, Long> numbers = builder.stream(stringSerde, longSerde, TOPIC);
numbers.map((key, value) -> new KeyValue<Object, Object>(key, value * 2)).print();

When you don't finish your topology with print() it works as expected.

I was talking to Guozhang and he asked me to prepare and example to reproduce this so that here it is:
https://github.com/yshadow/kafka-streams-again

MarekSvitok Thanks for filing this issue. I looked into the print function and found there is a minor issue causing us trying to close System.out, which will be a blocking call.

I will submit a PR to fix this issue.

GitHub user guozhangwang opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1965

KAFKA-4176: Only call printStream.flush for System.out

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/guozhangwang/kafka K4176-only-flush-for-standardoutput

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1965.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #1965

commit 87c8d45ee42218921ebec55101d4722245bcf1a2
Author: Guozhang Wang <wangguoz@gmail.com>
Date: 2016-10-04T21:37:54Z

Only call flush for System.out

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1965

Issue resolved by pull request 1965
https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/1965
